oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Tennessee Union soldier James N. Levi
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from James Noah Levi to Eunice C. "Nicey" Vandergriff Levi, his wife. (See chat029 for details of Levi's service) He tells her that he is still alive and chides her for not writing back or acknowledging the money he has sent. He hopes that "wee may; re[a]tch that happy shore where parting is nomore and trubbell never com[es]." Tell the children to "remember hee is on the rite side and fi[gh]ting for the rite cause." Longs for news "of the folks."
